The Role: 33Across is seeking an experienced Senior Data Analystto lead the research and development of new audience insights and capabilities, leveraging 33Across vast data assets to fuel monetization of our data product suite. For more than 8 years, 33Across has been helping publishers navigate the shifting digital landscape by building products that drive incremental revenue, increase user engagement, and deliver key insights about their audiences. As the industry shifts to more transparency and control, your focus will be leading the vision, user experience, build-out, and go-to-market strategy for our platform portal that is accessed daily by our publishers, advertisers, and internal teams globally.You Will: Analyze large amounts of data to develop audience data insights and formulate new data offerings and metrics using 33Across massive breadth of data assets (such as ad engagement and RTB signals). Work hand-in-hand with Product Management to support new data product discovery, prototype potential audience products, and assess viability. Areas of interest include: Audience insights, Segment analysis, Attribution Modelling, Lift indexing, and data avails/forecasting. Become an expert in the 33Across product suite. Develop client-centric insights for data customers and strategic partners to help drive adoption and stickiness with key clients. Assist Product in validating new data offerings by conducting experiments to assess lift and adoption (e.g. using our bidstream traffic as a proxy for baseline internet behavior). Work closely with the engineering and product teams on specifications and implementation of new features that become productized. Be able to present results to relevant stakeholders and effectively defend your findings. Stay current with products/solutions in the media technology space for industry trends, new areas of insights-based innovation, and competitive intelligence.You Have: 5+ years professional experience in analytics at a digital agency, ad network, or relevant ad tech/media company. Strong understanding of the digital media ecosystem and technologies. BS in technical or business field - Mathematics/statistics a bonus. MS preferred. Experience using Big Data tools with emphasis predictive segmentation/classification and regression. Exp. with machine learning/unsupervised techniques is super. Proficient in R (or statistical modeling software) and SQL. Python, SAS, SPSS, a bonus. Familiarity using Apache Spark, Hadoop MapReduce, Hive, and Pig. Technical background with experience working in a lean / agile product environment. Strong communication and client presentation skills. Experience in defining, designing, building, and managing new analytics products.What We Can Offer You: We have a distributed team with primary work locations in New York City and the Bay Area. We offer a fun work environment with smart coworkers and generous perks. Perks include unlimited snacks/drinks, weekly lunch, team outings, holiday celebrations, and annual hackathons.Oh Yeah, We Also Offer All The Usual Stuff Too: Competitive salary, bonus structure, and equity Health, vision, and dental benefits 401K matching to help you save for the future Real, tangible, paid time off Paid maternity and paternity leave

Great Oaks Legacy OverviewThe Great Oaks Legacy Charter School is a high-performing, innovative charter public school in Newark NJ, serving 1,560 students from Pre-K to 12th grade across five campuses in Newark. Our mission is to prepare public school students for success in college. Great Oaks Legacy students aspire to be some of the highest performing students in the country.We have high academic and behavioral expectations for our students. Our students, for example, are encouraged to take multiple AP classes before they graduate. We pair rigorous curriculum and teaching with intense personal support from teachers, tutors, and staff. The school’s mission is to prepare our students for college success through several key elements:Small school – Grade-level cohorts of less 100 students allow each student to feel known and cared for. Our focus is on a sense of community and relationship building with families and studentsMore time on task – Longer school days than traditional schools. Weekend sessions and summer school for students who are struggling.High expectations – Rigorous, differentiated, college-preparatory coursework from K-12. Advanced Placement and real college courses for all juniors and seniors.Effective Instruction – World-class teachers with clear expectations and the support they need to continuously improve.Data and Reporting Manager Role Description:The Data and Reporting Manager is a newly-created role that will be critical to the ability of Great Oaks Legacy to grow with quality and sustainability. Working across disciplines in the network, the Data and Reporting Manager will help ensure that campus and network leadership, the Board of Directors, and external partners and governmental organizations receive accurate, timely information about our academic and financial performance.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Leading the development and implementation of the organization’s first set of data dashboards, designed to provide key stakeholders with the informationCreating reliable, timely requests for reimbursement for grant funding, the school food program, and private grantsSupporting campus leaders and teachers in designing and implementing innovative, data-driven Response to Intervention programs that meet the needs of students and fit within federal and state regulations for the use of Title 1 funding.Leveraging assessment data sets to support the production of ambitious annual goals for individual students and for campuses and the network as a whole.Responding to requests for data and reporting by private funders and public stakeholders.Supporting the cultivation of grants and private philanthropy via the creation of compelling, accurate statistics about the school’s performance and demographics.Other duties and special projects as assigned by the Chief Financial Officer and Executive Director.TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT:The Data and Reporting Manager is a twelve-month employee with salary to be recommended by Executive Director and approved by the board.REPORTING RELATIONSHIP:The Data and Reporting Manager is a part of the Talent and Finance Team, working out of GOLCS’ Network Office, and reports to the Chief Financial Officer.EVALUATION: The Data and Reporting Manager is evaluated annually on both the specific goals set out in conjunction with her/his manager and on the school’s overall expectations for all team members.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelors degree, with fluency in mathematics, statistics and data analysis strongly preferredAt least 2 years of professional experience, preferably in an education or non-profit analyst settingFluency learning and manipulating online databases and assessment platformsDemonstrated passion for closing the achievement gap in urban schools.GREAT OAKS LEGACY PHILOSOPHY Our students arrive, on average, significantly behind grade level. Many live in poverty – a higher percentage than most schools in the country. Upon arrival, they are statistically less than 10% likely to graduate with a 4-year degree. Our mission is that each child ultimately graduates from college. Therefore: Employee takes responsibility to reverse negative outcomes of failing students, to make every effort to work proactively and reactively to engage each and every student, such that each is legitimately prepared to succeed in college.It is a given that all of the faculty work very, very hard. All staff, including the Campus Directors, Admin Teams, CAO, CEO, President, Operations Team and COO and Employee, acknowledge that we will do more than just work hard; we each seek – through formal and informal feedback – to dramatically improve. At Great Oaks Legacy, an ongoing quest for improvement is not considered remedial, it is essential and ongoing for all staff.

job_title: Asset Backed Securities, Associate Director, Credit Analyst - NY
job_description: Fitch Ratings Asset Back Securities Group is adding a new Associate Director to join our growing team. Reporting into a Senior Director, this person assumes a role in rating of ABS transactions (including student loan, auto loan and auto lease, unsecured consumer loans and Asset Backed Commercial paper conduits), authoring market commentary and related research, serving as a credit committee member in reviewing and assigning ratings to ABS transactions and participating in criteria and cash flow model projects.  Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  - Analyzing critical credit, legal and structural elements of asset backed transaction structures Producing quality internal and external written reports including credit committees, criteria, special reports and market commentaryCommunicating Fitch rating methodology and criteria to issuers and investorsLeading and/or supporting research projectsMaintaining assigned rating relationships The ideal candidate will have a BA/BS degree, and four to 7 years of work experience. Strong quantitative and analytical skills, proficiency in Excel and Word, strong communication (particularly writing), analytical, organizational, and time-management skills are a must.Dual-headquartered in New York and London, Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide help investors to make important credit judgments with confidence.  Fitch Solutions delivers credit market data, analytical tools and risk services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, Fitch Solutions distributes the ratings, research and financial data of Fitch Ratings through a variety of flexible platforms. With innovation and experience behind every solution, Fitch Solutions helps financial professionals meet the diverse and evolving needs of today’s global markets.  Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions, along with Fitch Learning and BMI Research, are part of the Fitch Group, a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is majority-owned by Hearst.  Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions are an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, complying with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which operating, and provide equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and other status protected by applicable laws.  Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.  For more information about this policy, please visit the code of ethics and conduct page - http://www.fitchratings.com/web/en/dynamic/about-us/code-of-ethics-and-conduct.jsp

job_title: Associate, Product Business Analyst -Client Reference Data Operations
job_description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/. The Chief Administrative Office Operations team supports compliance, and manages and maintains reference data to ensure that our customers, employees, and lines of business are in adherence with firm standards and required regulations. Our mission is to improve the quality of reference data used across the organization and provide compliance operational support across the firm’s global businesses and functions. We are driving a culture of quality and continuous improvement toward the best outcome for client experience, our colleagues and JPMorgan Chase. We do the right thing, even when it’s not the easy thing. If you're interested in working in an environment where leadership, excellence, integrity, and diversity are among our core principles, then explore the opportunities at J.P. Morgan Chase.Party Reference Data Operations (PRD) is an operating unit center of excellence that enables multiple lines of business across J.P. Morgan Chase to leverage consistent, high-quality Party reference data. The team’s responsibilities include setting up, maintaining and off-boarding Party reference data, as well as supporting targeted data quality remediation efforts. PRD also supports the External Data Domain, which involves definitional and data model work.The PRD Product team supports the different Party reference data products used at J.P. Morgan Chase. Product Business Analysts (BAs) support the planning and execution of changes made to these products, and partner closely with stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of tactical and strategic change efforts.The candidate must be a change agent who can influence stakeholders and provide factual analysis to support the decision making process. The candidate must be results oriented and able to clearly articulate any issues impeding progress along with proposed resolution recommendations. Key Responsibilities and Skills As a Product Owner/business analyst, you will provide excellent business and system analysis to deliver automated solutions to meet the requirements provided by businesses, technology users, Operations teams, and chief data officers. In this position you will be responsible for: Interviewing requestors to gather/validate facts and requirementsWriting and syndicating project plans, requirements documents and release communications, in collaboration with various stakeholder groupsTranslating requirements documents into Agile storiesCreating test cases, running Agile ceremonies (i.e., product backlog, sprint planning, sprint review) with technology teams, and driving technology priorities and deliverablesClearly defining objectives, leading the development of an implementation plan for the technology solution, and overseeing the execution of that planIdentifying issues and developing and communicating resolutionsReviewing the current operating model for various products and processes, and creating functional requirements to gain operational efficienciesReviewing current tools used by Operations, and creating requirements to streamline processes and reportingAd-hoc project work as directed Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree 5-7 years relevant experience in technology business analysis, preferably in financial servicesFamiliarity with data management, reference data, client onboarding and Know Your Customer (KYC) processes, and industry sources of reference data is preferable but not mandatoryExperience driving Agile ceremonies independently, collaboratively and confidently.Experience in full systems development lifecycle from project initiation, requirements definition, user acceptance testing through implementation Experience in writing test plans, test scripts and test casesExperience working in reference data platforms and/or with external market vendor products (e.g., BVD, Markit, etc.)Well-organized with strong attention to detail, communication and presentation skills (verbal and written)Ability to work independently and multi-task in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrated ability to effectively communicate within a team environment and interact across departmentsSelf-motivated, proactive, and flexible to work alone and with a team to meet targetsStrong Client and Stakeholder focusProven ability to work accurately and under pressure to meet deadlines Intermediate to Advanced experience using JIRA, Microsoft Excel, and PowerPoint

Requisition Number:4096Job Title:Data Classification Analyst IILocation(s):Iselin CorporateFull Time/Part Time:Regular Full-TimeJob Description:POSITION OVERVIEWThis is an individual contributor position within the Digital and Data Strategy Department reporting to the Data Governance Lead. The role is to support the Data Classification Program and work related to the identification, classification and ownership of corporate assets. This position will also be responsible for participating in risk assessment activities across the bank to determine criticality of new and existing systems and applications, and determine level of controls necessary to identify, classify, protect and monitor the various types of data present in the Investors Bank environment to prevent unauthorized exposure.Assessing, recommending, and implementing continuous process improvement programs for security, data classification is also critically important. RESPONSIBILITIES Assist with maturing the Data Governance/ Data Classification Program which includes defining a Data Classification and Sensitive Data Handling Program, identifying Data Owners, and assisting with design and implementation of a Data Classification and Rights Management tool such as Varonis. Collaborate with business and stakeholders to identify, define, implement and maintain sensitive and business critical data in accordance with regulatory, contractual, business requirements and data classification standards.Plan, develop, implement and report of procedures for the current data classification monitoring and metrics program leveraging CIMCON discovery and analytics tool (Risk-XL and SOX-XL) or equivalent technology for End User Computing Controls.Assist with developing and publishing data classification reports and updates to bank-wide employees.Revise the data shared across the bank and capture how it flows among the systems and business until.Work with the LOB Managers to refresh and conduct periodic data inventory of application residing on the bank's network.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop tactical relationships with external vendors.Requirements:Possess a minimum of 3-5 years of progressive and current experience in Financial Services, especially in the Technology area. A Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required. The ideal candidate would have experience in various internal systems, processes, and organizational structure at Investors Bank.Experience with data classification guidelines and data life cycle process. Working knowledge to support large scale projects such as conversions of data and integration of Systems processes. Experience with concepts of data integrity, privacy, and security of directory services, understanding of general network components, concepts, and n-tiered architectures.Hands-on experience to respond to internal audit findings by researching solutions and recommending process improvements.Experience in documenting standard operating procedures and working with senior management to gain acceptance.Demonstrated communication skills with the ability to build relationship with business and stakeholders to get results.Experience in governance frameworks including: ISO27001, NIST, COBIT.Experience with Data Classification concepts and products such as Varonis and Titus.Experience is End User Computing Tools such as CIMCON or equivalent technology preferred.Knowledge in regulations such as Sarbanes Oxley, GLBA, SOC/SSAE16 preferred.Experience using Microsoft Office Products such as Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Word.DESIREDProfessional Certification such as CISSP, CISA, CISM or CRISC is a plus. Project Management experience Desired.

Must have- Data analysis and advanced Xcel, Pivot tables etc.  Sas programming or "R? programming is a big plus.  Nice if worked in digital or marketing organization.  Does not want an IT analyst.  Does not want someone that needs hand holding  Likes people from financial services and Credit card services is good but of course pharma is best.  Mgr will tell you what he needs, candidate will get the data and organize data, put it in front of a data strategist to look at it.SDL2017

The Safety Data Analyst is responsible for performing searches in the database and generating complete and accurate reports for internal and external customers, including regulatory authorities. In addition, the Safety Data Analyst is also responsible for ensuring that information entered and retrieved from the databases is consistent and accurate. job_title: CAO Operations Business Analyst - Strategy Associate, Finance Reference Data Adoption
job_description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/.  The Chief Administrative Office Operations team supports compliance, and manages and maintains reference data to ensure that our customers, employees, and lines of business are in adherence with firm standards and required regulations.  Our mission is to improve the quality of reference data used across the organization and provide compliance operational support across the firms global businesses and functions. We are driving a culture of quality and continuous improvement toward the best outcome for client experience, our colleagues and JPMorgan Chase. We do the right thing, even when its not the easy thing.  If you're interested in working in an environment where leadership, excellence, integrity, and diversity are among our core principles, then explore the opportunities at J.P. Morgan Chase.  One of the top priorities across the Chief Administrative Office at JPMorgan Chase is to help the firm move toward a more integrated data management strategy. The mandate of the Reference Data arm of the Chief Administrative Office (CAO) is to manage reference data across the enterprise, establish firmwide reference data governance processes and quality standards, manage all reference data operations teams, and partner with the lines of business to drive alignment to firmwide reference data standards. Our businesses and corporate groups rely on reference data to facilitate and execute transactions, support our clients, identify potential risks, and meet regulatory requirements. Today, CAOReference Data comprises a senior leadership team managing ~500 operations, project and strategy staff.  Some of Our most significant internal clients are the Finance & Risk functions of the Firm, including the Finance & Risk Roadmap Program which is a multi-hundred million dollar investment to simplify and upgrade the Firms data infrastructure and data management practices for Finance & Risk. We also work closely with the Firmwide Data Management Program led by the Firms Chief Data Officer.  We are recruiting team focused on ensuring that we deliver high quality reference data to consumers in Finance & Risk, by ensuring that the Key Data Providers to the Finance and Risk Aggregators like Finance Risk warehouse and Risk Central, as well as the Consuming Risk and Finance Applications downstream of these Aggregators have adopted Strategic Financial Reference Data and are plugged into the System of Record (RefODS) or an Authoritative Data Source like RDR for sourcing and validating Financial Reference Data.  Responsibilities: Build Strong engagement with stakeholders across LoBs to present and drive the business case for Strategic Financial Reference Data Adoption.Partner with LoB Technology and Operations teams to frame an approach for Adoption.Liaise with the extended team around DQ Metrics across applications and Feed Certification results, to focus on applications with significant adoption gaps as a priority.Create a comprehensive Plan/Schedule for Adoption across LoB applications and obtain buy-in from relevant stakeholders.Manage Risks/Issues through implementing mitigation measures against each milestone to ensure timely delivery.Lead Cross-LoB SteerCos as well as Project Working groups focused on individual applications to drive the Adoption agenda.Maintain an Adoption Scorecard that covers various work streams of the Program and succinctly provides the management with an accurate and clear status of the Program.Chair and Guide Technically intense working sessions focused on moving some of the consumers of Legacy Financial Reference Data tables to Strategic Alternatives.  This role requires close interaction with Finance and Risk, Technology and Operations teams. Success requires a commitment to driving change in particular, aspiring candidates must possess four key attributes:Strong Project Management acumen. Ability to lead multiple concurrent work streams.Excellent Analytical skills, including superior capabilities for synthesis and presentation of complex data.Executive presentation and Reporting dexterity. The role will demand chairing SteerCos attended by several Tech and Ops Executives.Understanding of the key finance and risk disciplines, including financial reporting, credit risk, market risk, model risk, liquidity risk, interest rate risk, etc. so as to be able to understand the implications and impact to these functions due to inaccurate Data .Knowledge of data sources and repositories related to these key finance and risk disciplines, or ability to rapidly assimilate knowledge about them.Ability to understand technology with respect to data management, e.g., data flows/lineage, requirements and functional specification documents; and consensus-building and communication skills sufficiently powerful to drive technological and operating model change.  The ideal candidate will also have strong client management and senior management-level communication skills, experience structuring and scoping complex problems, and the ability to apply a range of analytical tools to develop solutions to those problems. Very strong critical and creative thinking skills and a willingness to work with ambiguity must be demonstrated. Previous experience driving strategic and tactical process improvement initiatives in data/technology-heavy functions/programs is highly desirable.The ideal candidate will have an undergraduate degree with a relevant subject major, from a good school, plus 3-5 years financial services experience, some of which has been either at a management consulting firm or in an internal transformational role, with data, technology and operations experience blended with knowledge of key finance and risk disciplines. Exposure to or involvement with data management and/or data quality programs is preferred.In addition:Experience in the financial services industry and/or financial industry knowledge is essential, and knowledge of key finance and risk disciplines is highly desirable.Problem solving skills: Strong ability to rapidly learn the intricacies of an unfamiliar process, structure and scope complex problems, apply a range of analytical tools, gain and synthesize insights, and develop actionable recommendationsAnalytical skills: Highly analytical, with experience in defining analytical approaches for projects and collecting, analyzing, and synthesizing data from multiple sources to develop actionable solutions. Adeptness with MS Excel is important.Comfort with data and technology: Prior experience functioning in roles and functions that are highly data-driven and that required understanding of data models and flows, and technology architecture as related to business requirements, including comfort interacting with internal technology teams. Prior experience in a Tech-related function in Finance and/or Risk would be a huge asset.Communications skills: Strong written and oral executive-level communications skills, including the ability to quickly convey complex topics in easily understood formats.Teamwork skills: Flexible work style, be able to work with stakeholders and colleagues at all levels.Presentation Skills: Good knowledge and comfort with PowerPoint/PitchPro.This and related positions will be based at Brooklyns MetroTech Center. Travel to midtown on a regular basis to work with others in CAO, Finance & Risk and Firmwide Data Management should be expected.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Referential Data and Trading Technologies
job_description: JOB DESCRIPTION Job Purpose  The New York Stock Exchange (an Intercontinental Exchange company) is seeking a Senior Analyst that can fill both a Business and a Data Analyst role in the Product Management Group. This group provides development and support services for enterprise applications used across all of NYSE's Trading platforms. The experienced Senior Business/Data Analyst supporting Referential Data and Trading Technologies will provide both statistical analysis and data mining support to deliver enhance business, operational and customer reporting for the organization.  Duties and Responsibilities  Take ownership of requirements and delivery through full project lifecycle: Collaborate closely with business, technical and operational stakeholders to identify and prioritize functional and technical enhancements, elicit functional needs and define innovative yet implementable functional requirementsDetermine business and operational objectives by analyzing existing business functionsCritically evaluate information, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level informationUse statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports.Perform scenario analysis and functional coverageDocument business processes through workflow diagramsMaintain traceability of functional specifications to business requirements/objectivesDesign wireframes/mock-ups of functional requirementsAnalyze and evaluate test cases to ensure adequate test coverage on requirementsSupport business teams in Data querying and analysis to recognize trends, identify outliers and support the decision making process Knowledge and Experience Degree from a leading business school or university Masters preferable.Requires 5+ years of related professional experience (BA or management consulting).Requires 3+ years data analyst experienceRequires 3+ years' experience in a financial industry/financial services.Energetic, motivated, with a strong work ethic, willing to take on challenging tasksDesire to work in a fast paced, team oriented environment, yet comfortable working independently and taking on time sensitive assignments.Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirementsThorough understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Excellent level of knowledge & experience using both Waterfall & Agile development methodologiesIn-depth experience in Structured Query Language (SQL) preferred.Knowledge of relational databases and conceptsAbility to understand and interpret complex data relationships and queries preferred.Able to actively participate in data design/modeling discussions.Experience with JIRA, Sharepoint and ServiceNow a plus. Core Competencies  Competencies are the skills and behaviors that are critical both to your personal performance and to ICE's continued success. The core competencies apply to every member of staff working for ICE.  Teamwork Offers time and/or assistance to colleagues; is widely regarded and respected as someone to go to for helpFosters friendly and cooperative relationships with others; colleagues enjoy working with theemployeeShares knowledge and mentors staff; works to develop others' knowledge as well as ownGives and shares credit as appropriateContributes to recruiting and training efforts of others, including candidate referrals, job interviews and mentoringAttends and participates in company and department level functions inside and outside of the office Problem-Solving & Decision-Making Demonstrates an understanding of the urgent nature of our business and the need to proactively find and fix problems quickly and effectively takes ownership and follows through on decisions; doesn't minimize or forget about problemsDetermines and fixes root causes rather than just treating symptomsApplies novel techniques to solve problems that are more ambiguous; challenges long-held beliefs when necessaryQuickly and effectively identifies alternative solutions and the pros/cons of each; confirms that a proposed solution has no unintended consequencesTakes steps to mitigate riskConsults with colleagues and recommends solutions based on the best interests of customers and shareholders, even when the opinion is unpopular Communication Actively listens and speaks to, not over, othersUses clear and constructive language orally and in writingCommunicates important developments to the relevant and appropriate audiences in a timely and consistent mannerAsks follow-up questions to ensure all points are understoodTakes time to objectively listen to all viewpoints before forming an opinionBuilds consensus among differing views Professionalism & Integrity Makes a positive impression; represents the company well on the phone and in person, including maintaining attire and appearance that is consistent with company image and appropriate for employee's roleModels a 'can-do' attitude and takes initiative as a self-starter; inspires and motivates others to do the sameEmbraces, rather than resists, additional responsibilitiesRefrains from office gossip; settles rather than creates conflict with and between othersExhibits desired work habits including regular office hours and extra hours when necessary while minimizing breaks and non-work related activitiesAdheres to all corporate policies; makes prudent use of company resourcesLOCATION NY: New York (11 Wall Street) FULL TIME / PART TIME Full time  Intercontinental ExchangeICE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.SDL2017

Tracking Code 5216-292 Job Description It’s an exciting time to be part of the IFF IT team at our Union Beach, NJ location. With Frutarom combined; IFF is 129 years old, has greater than $5BB Revenue, contains over 13,000 employees, supports 160 locations, serving 33,000 customers with 150,000 products. IFF is transforming our services to meet the heightened expectations of a highly creative, international and mobile workforce. As the organization is moving towards becoming a leading digital organization, data and analytics are key capabilities that provide insights and decision making. As the Lead Advanced Analytics Engineer, you will be focused on various data initiatives and dabble in different technologies to move the organizational data management and analytics capabilities forward.You will spend your time…Providing high quality solutions that address business needsEngineering Big Data Platform and toolsets for business intelligence and advanced analytics capabilitiesCreating conceptual, logical, and physical architecture for data storage, processing, reporting, and analytics, leveraging emerging technologiesDesigning and implementing a state-of-the-art and user friendly central data management system Required Skills Support system integration of diverse data sources and technologies used in the design, construction, testing, deployment and operations of BI solutionsProvide architectural expertise and long-term vision to build scalable business intelligence platformDocument success criteria and monitor solution effectiveness, including system performance, adoption and other key metrics. Work on Systems integration, including design and development of APIs and AdaptersImplement best practice tools and processes for ensuring data quality to support data identificationFeature creation by working closely with the BI/Advanced Analytics teams on delivering Intelligence and Insights on raw data with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Forecasting, Advanced Search, Statistical Modeling capabilities, etc.Work with Application teams to build data capabilities Required Experience MS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or quantitative fields5+ years of data analysis, preferably with a technology companyHands on Technical Manager with a strong analytics background, supporting large scale applications.Must have Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Forecasting, Advanced Search, Big Data architecture, Business Intelligence and Statistical Modeling capabilitiesExperience with Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, R and PythonPreferred Experience: AWS PlatformBI ToolsSAS and SPSSLeadership Behaviors: This position will require the applicant to be in a leadership role focused on various data initiatives. The applicant will be able to work both independently and collaborate with a diverse group of teammates.Our business is fueled by a sense of discovery; by consistently asking “What If?” To learn more about the possibilities please visit IFF.com Job Location Union Beach, New Jersey, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular

Sr. Data Analyst Job ID: 2018-21178 Location: Long Island City, NY  Altice USA (NYSE: ATUS) is one of the largest broadband communications and video services providers in the United States, delivering broadband, pay television, telephony services, proprietary content and advertising services to approximately 4.9 million Residential and Business customers across 21 states through its Optimum and Suddenlink brands.  From high-speed broadband and ultra-HD video, to digital advertising solutions, local news and voice offerings, we are making connections possible around the country -- to businesses, to consumers, to communities, to schools, to hospitals, and everyone in between.  We are looking for a data analyst with an interest in TV/internet audience data, media research and advertising who will mine internal datasets to create presentations that drive profitable growth while exploring new, advanced approaches to elevate analytic rigor.  The Senior Analyst will be responsible for daily reporting and development of projects requested by both internal and external teams. The senior analyst will combine technical expertise in SQL development, hands-on expertise creating data visualization and applying statistics, and knowledge of customer behavior/subscriber lifecycle management.  The main functions the senior analyst performs are: Data mining, both independently and together with data science teamBuilds interesting and appealing decks with visuals that bring the data to life to tell a story or create sleek interactive visuals for data explorationLeads development in the evaluation of metrics data to provide analytics insightsCreates high quality deliverables that are both actionable and understandable to technical and nontechnical stakeholdersSupports ad hoc development utilizing SQL and data interface modulesBalances pragmatism with scientific rigor to improve decision making as the product iterates quicklyAnticipates analytical needs proactively reviewing data gathering and anomalies within reporting and brings to management's attentionDelivers on short-term requests along with complex analysesRecognized as subject matter expert Candidates who have a portfolio of previous work that can be showcased during the interview process will be given a higher preference. A Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required; a Master's degree (or equivalent) is a plus3-5 years of data research and/or analytics. Media research a plus.Experience handling complex data visualization for Big Data sets is highly desiredAdvanced knowledge of Data Visualization Software (Tableau, Spotfire, Visual Insights)Excellent SQL Skills and Database KnowledgeFamiliarity with Statistical Methodologies and Terminology is a plusHighly motivated with flexibility to take on new challenges and adopt new technologiesAbility to collaborate across the formal boundaries and locations and work with Global distributed teams in different regions Excellent communications skills and manage all stakeholders with high professionalism and integrityProactive, solution oriented, persistent and dependable We are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vet and maintain a drug-free and smoke-free workplace.SDL2017

Our client, one of the largest Amazon Web Services (AWS) partner for data services, is looking for top talent to join their elite team of technologists to build and contribute to large-scale, innovative projects. Our client wants candidates who are eager to learn and grow with them as they work to move their market monitoring applications to modern big data platforms in the cloud where up to 60 billion market events are being processed each day. &nbsp &nbsp If you are a fast learner, have a sharp mathematical and technical mind and are interested in working for one of the biggest data users in the country in a fast-paced, open source environment, our client has an immediate need for a Business Analyst to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems. &nbsp &nbsp Job Responsibilities: Technical data mining skills and requirements Using SQL to analyze various data sources to determine best way to detect a behavior of interest within the data Documenting how to use the data to detect a behavior of interest (pattern) BAs are required to document both business requirements based on the business problem AND document data specifications based on the specific data to be used to detect the behavior Data analysis skills there are frequently data anomalies (missing records, erroneous data elements) in the source systems Ability to write a clear and concise description of the problem and pattern impacts to the business users Verbal Communication Skills - for all analysis and requirements work, the BA is responsible; To not only understand the business problem that the pattern is trying to detect or solve, but also be able to verbally explain it to any number of development and QC staff who do not have the same level of business understanding To understand at an in-depth level the specific data that is used to detect the behavior and why the behavior of interest will manifest itself in the data in a particular way. The key with the in-depth data knowledge for the pattern is to also be able to explain this in great detail to the development and QC staff To be able to verbally translate the various data conditions into business language for the business users to understand and present options to them for Written Communication Skills Most of the business users are lawyers, so attention to detail is of utmost importance within this group. Even minor typographical errors or formatting problems must be avoided when presenting to the business users Be able to pick up, understand and utilize industry jargon within whatever the BA will be writing Strong MS Word skills writing, formatting, etc. &nbsp &nbsp Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required &nbsp Other Skills/Interests: Financial Industry experience. Master s Degree in Technical area Masters of Business Administration (MBA) &nbsp &nbsp ConsultNet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, age, military or veteran status, and other characteristics protected under federal, state and local law. job_description: Position: HRIS Data and Reporting Analyst Location: North American Support Center (NASC)GROW With US! For 30 years Hudson Group has led the way and prides itself in knowing what matters in travel retail. As airports and transportation terminals have evolved, so has Hudson Group, striving to bring sophistication and convenience to today's traveler.  Hudson Group is North America's largest specialty travel retailer. JOB DESCRIPTION: The HRIS Data and Reporting Analyst provides day to day support for HR systems, including advanced reporting, data entry and maintenance, troubleshooting and various analysis as well as resolving support issues by working directly with both internal clients and external service providers. This individual will drive the successful delivery of accurate human capital metrics for the business and ensure data integrity for all HR systems. The HRIS Data and Reporting Analyst will also be responsible for documenting system processes and procedures and assist in the training of end-users. This position is open to all US Locations.The Data Migration Analyst will be techno-functional expert having great coordination, communication and management skills. Initially, the Data Migration Analyst will support our Accelerate program, Stryker’s largest transformational program to date, and will support our SAP ERP system. The Data Migration Analyst will be responsible for the completion of functional requirements and field mapping documentation for assigned data objects. This individual will be an integral part of the data conversion test cycles, supporting all the issues resolution activities between the technical teams, work stream leads, data domain leads, and SME's. provide necessary trainings to communicate changes and measure outcomes.Minimum Education, Experience & Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university required. Family Health Centers at NYU Langone, a designated Level 3 Medical Home, is the largest federally qualified health center network in New York State, and the second largest in the nation. It includes nine primary care sites, 33 school-based health centers and dental clinics, four day care centers, the nation's largest dental residency program, and New York State's largest behavioral health program. The network also includes 12 community medicine sites providing care to disenfranchised New Yorkers, comprehensive HIV services, chemical dependency programs, and a family support center that offers educational, vocational, and other social support programs. Learn more about Family Health Centers at NYU Langone. Position Summary: We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Sr Data Analyst. ETO) as needed.Provide basic technology support and training to staff and develop and deliver trainings as neededRun and perform quality assurance for monthly reports submitted to a variety of public and private fundersAssist in management and troubleshooting for programs using in-house database systems (eg. Masters preferred. 2+years. Preferred Qualifications: Interest in working with programs that serve vulnerable populations, and a desire to facilitate improved client outcomes through workflow design and program evaluation  High level ability in MS Excel and Access, and ability to learn and adapt new software quickly are a must  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively as part of an interdisciplinary team  Prior experience with web-based CRM (client relationship management) system, especially Efforts to Outcomes  Experience with writing queries for relational database software (such as SQL)  Some experience or knowledge of statistics and statistical software packages Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. job_title: GIS Business and Data Analyst - Frankfort, KY
job_description: Req ID: 37501 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.  NTT DATA Services currently seeks a GIS Business and Data Analyst - Frankfort, KY to join our team in Frankfort, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).  We are seeking a skilled GIS Business and Data Analyst. The selected candidate will provide support for maintenance and development of a digital highway network and associated data, including software, customizations, and data sharing with other highway database systems. This person will become familiar with existing data systems, the business they support, and the role each play as part of the overall enterprise and support of the organization's mission. They will work to coordinate enterprise-wide data maintenance, storage, and reporting efforts. They will become familiar with existing data integrations and reporting environments, and assist with continued development of a comprehensive, sustainable, data warehouse to facilitate integration, support highway applications, and provide easy access to information for tabular and spatial reporting and analysis. Primary Skills/Responsibilities: Have good knowledge of database tools, including SQL, to manipulate and report tabular data, build reportsHave functional knowledge of the unique database structures used to locate highway infrastructure data to a linear highway network and the techniques used for linking systems with linear networks.Acquire a sound understanding of the business areas, their data systems, their interdependencies and collective role for KYTCDefine and estimate tasks necessary to accomplish assigned goalsHave a good understanding of GIS tools and concepts, including ESRI and Oracle spatial, and be able to utilize these tools to spatially manipulate and analyze the transportation network and highway data Ask relevant questions to understand needs and requirements with the ability to provide feedback on possible implications of requestsArticulate issues, questions, and recommendations to team members and managementIdentify gaps in requirements between what is in place and what is neededProvide training to end users on the use of internally developed or off the shelf tools used to maintain highway dataPosses skills with tabular and spatial database analysis tools.Other duties as assignedBasic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree with a focus in IT or equivalent combination of experience/knowledge10 + years’ experience working with database and GIS toolsThis position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.  NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Dual-headquartered in New York and London, Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide help investors to make important credit judgments with confidence.  Fitch Solutions delivers credit market data, analytical tools and risk services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, Fitch Solutions distributes the ratings, research and financial data of Fitch Ratings through a variety of flexible platforms. With innovation and experience behind every solution, Fitch Solutions helps financial professionals meet the diverse and evolving needs of today’s global markets.  Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions, along with Fitch Learning, are part of the Fitch Group, a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is wholly-owned by Hearst.  Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions are an equal opportunity / affirmative action employer, complying with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which operating, and provide equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and other status protected by applicable laws. Job Description Perform surveillance review of customer and commercial asset-backed transactions, particularly in student loan, auto loan, and timeshare backed securities. Project credit losses using static pool-based performance data and the company’s nominal and percentage extrapolation methods. Conduct cash flow modeling and structural analysis in accordance with transaction documents. Assure the quality of student loan asset-backed securities (ABS) transaction databases by verifying with servicers and issuers, and cross-checking with other available data sources. Provide advanced data and technical support, using Excel and VBA, for the ABS team by reorganizing large data sets to create performance charts and other standard analytical templates. Conduct back-testing of rating criteria to validate assumptions for losses, recoveries, prepayments, and other key rating drivers. Lead user acceptance testing and rating impact assessment of criteria and model changes. Lead data projects that contribute to the automation of the transaction surveillance process, including data collection and processing, and data feed to analytical tools. Review counterparty agreements and financial statements to assess credit, legal, and operations risks of transaction counterparties, including derivative counterparties, account banks, and servicers and originators. Produce quality internal and external written reports, including credit committees, special reports, and market commentary. Communicate the company’s rating methodology and rating rationale to issuers and investors. Work with asset-backed securities, financial analysis, quantitative modeling, pivot tables, advanced formulas and charting, Macros, Excel, VBA, Word, databases, and structured finance products. Job Skills Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or a related field of study, plus two (2) years of experience with asset-backed securities, financial analysis, quantitative modeling, pivot tables, advanced formulas and charting, Macros, Excel, VBA, Word, databases, and structured finance products.  #LI-DNP  Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.  For more information about this policy, please visit the code of ethics and conduct page - http://www.fitchratings.com/web/en/dynamic/about-us/code-of-ethics-and-conduct.jsp

Morgan StanleyMorgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. The talent and passion of our people is critical to our continued success as a firm. Together, we share four core values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic: 1. Putting Clients First2. Doing the Right Thing3. Leading with Exceptional Ideas4. Giving Back Morgan Stanley is committed to helping its employees build meaningful careers and we strive to be a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. Firm Risk ManagementFirm Risk Management (FRM) enables Morgan Stanley to achieve its business goals by partnering with business units across the Firm to realize efficient risk-adjusted returns, acting as a strategic advisor to the Board and protecting the Firm from exposure to losses as a result of credit, market, liquidity, operational, model and other risks. Our mission is to serve as the follow roles: · Independent agent to set consistent principles and disciplines for risk management · Strategic advisor to Firm management for setting risk appetite and allocating capital · Industry leader to influence and meet regulatory standards You will collaborate with colleagues across FRM and the Firm to protect the Firm’s capital base and franchise, advise businesses and clients on risk mitigating strategies, develop tools and methodologies to analyze and monitor risk, contribute to key regulatory initiatives and report on risk exposures and metrics to enable informed and strategic decision-making. Through thoughtful analysis and clear communication we are best able to bring our ideas to the table and improve the Firm. Firm Risk Management values diversity and is committed to providing a supportive and inclusive workplace for all employees. Firm Risk Management’s unique franchise promotes: ü Flat, flexible and integrated global organizationü Collaboration and teamworkü Credible, independent decision-makingü Organizational influenceü Creative and practical solutionsü Meritocratic and diverse culturePosition DescriptionMorgan Stanley Firm Risk Management (FRM) Department is seeking a Program Management Office analyst (PMO analyst) for the Risk Data and Strategy team based in New York. The focus of the PMO analyst is to co-ordinate with FRM Risk domain program managers and FRM Technology to prepare regular Risk Infrastructure program status reporting across the FRM department. The PMO Analyst will be responsible for the successful co-ordination and reporting of the FRM Risk Technology program portfolio, utilizing best practices around PMO and program governance methodology. In addition, the PMO Analyst will work closely with FRM Technology senior managers to develop topical presentations to the CRO and Risk COO, conveying Risk Technology initiatives and status.Responsibilities· Liaise and co-ordinate with FRM program managers and FRM technologists to gather and consolidate information for program status reporting (e.g. RAG, issues, actions, milestones etc) for regular reporting cycles· Work with FRM Technology to evolve and automate the program status reporting process in Jira· Implement program status reporting standards across FRM programs, leveraging Jira as the primary tracking tool.· Create program metrics, dashboards, and reports to summarize status with regard to the FRM programs for various senior management committees· Assemble, track and provide FRM-wide key program risks and issues, mitigations and communicate to the appropriate stakeholders in a timely manner· Prepare consolidated presentation materials and facilitate meetings with senior stakeholders to discuss statusSkills Required· 1-3 years’ relevant work experience · Experience within a financial institution and/or Top Tier consultant firm· Ability to manage multiple programs concurrently· Ability to run meetings with multiple stakeholders and business areas· Strong oral and written presentation skills including graphic illustrations· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills· Strong analytical and problem solving skills· Proficiency with Excel and PowerPointSkills Desired· Experience with Jira· Exposure to Agile / Sprint program management methodology

About Us: WhenWeber Shandwick was formed we set out a mission that, by design, has no enddate. We committed to be "engaging always." We knew then, and more sonow, that being open, aspirational and entrepreneurial is what it takes toengage people and deliver business impact in a rapidly changing environment.  Ourjourney to date might surprise you. From a powerful PR base, we've built-in oneof the world's largest, global social agencies. Then we added Mediaco, apioneering, award-winning content consulting and publishing operation. Andtoday, we continue to lead digital and advertising assignments for some of theworld's most enduring companies and social causes.  Alongthe way, we've been validated repeatedly by Ad Age's "A List," creativeleadership at Cannes Lions and global frontrunner status in the PR category.Yet despite our industry-leading status among marketing services agencies,we're still just getting started. We strive to bring our collectiveintelligence, open architecture model and continuous learning to our work, notto mention agility required to deliver it.  We'restrategists, builders, analysts, producers, designers, creatives,technologists. And we unite around big ideas.  So"engaging always." is really about innovative change. And that's what wecontinue do every day, adding new dimensions and diverse talent to our mixacross our network of more than 81 countries around the world. About Paxos: Paxos' mission is to modernize finance by mobilizing assets at the speed of the internet. Paxos is building a future where all assets--from money to gold to securities--will be digitized and move instantaneously, 24/7. Settlement risk will cease to exist, so trillions of dollars of trapped capital can go to work in a global, frictionless economy. (Check out our Twitter feed for the latest news and information.)Our Products include: Paxos Standard (PAX) is the worlds first regulated crypto asset, fully collateralized 1:1 by the U.S. dollar. This stablecoin offers a liquid, digital alternative to cash that is available 24/7 for instantaneous transaction settlement around the world. Launched in September 2018, its the most traded USD-backed stablecoin. itBit is a crypto-asset exchange with trading services including escrow, custody and OTC trading. Precious Metals: Based in London, our precious metals team works on a broad suite of products to simplify precious metals post-trade confirmations. The team launched Paxos Confirmation Service earlier this year. Since launch, the Paxos Confirmation Service has confirmed well over 100,000 trades with aggregate notional values in the hundreds of billions of dollars. We are looking for a Strategic Operations Analyst to join our rapidly growing FinTech company. The Strategic Operations Analyst help support firm-wide business operations and strategic infrastructure development and support for Paxos globally. The role will be a unique blend of both developing and delivering best in class business operations including asset settlement, reconciliation, analytical reporting and customer interaction. In addition, this person will have a hand in several special projects and strategic initiatives across the various products and stakeholders within Paxos, including crypto assets, securities and precious metals.Who You Are: You have 0-3 years of professional experience under your belt Because we are operating in a highly dynamic and diverse environment, were looking for someone smart with a knack for learning quickly and executing efficiently. You have comfort working in a tech-driven environment with the ability to coordinate across several stakeholder groups (Engineering, Operations, Compliance, Marketing, People, Strategic Initiatives-Office of the CEO) You have strong written and verbal communication skills You have strong project management orientation with the ability to communicate issues/concerns before they become fires and facilitate the right stakeholders in a discussion to solve for them You embody our culture and values You have the ability to think on your feet and adapt to changing priorities and demands What youll do: You will build a nimble infrastructure where we can support an expanding innovative product base. Additionally, were seeking someone who can execute all workflows for speed and accurate delivery while participating in strategic reengineering, audit, risk, and new business initiatives. You will actively engage with users and provide scaled support to resolve their issues, identify user trends, and work with cross-functional partners to resolve issues using technology and automation. You will actively partner cross-functionally with stakeholders of the engineering, and other cross functional partners to build scale and promote risk mitigation policy. You will drive delivery of operational milestones and strategic initiatives set by Operations Management at the company-wide level by ensuring rigor through best-in-class project management practices and by applying critical thinking to each business decisionPaxos is an equal opportunity employer. It does not discriminate on the basis of sex, age, color, race, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical and mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

Description Position at Rockstar New YorkRockstar Games is seeking an experienced data analyst to join our growing Analytics practice and help build Rockstars business intelligence capacity. Successful candidates will work with analytics and product leadership to assure that the most relevant possible real-time and historical data is identified, tracked, analyzed, and made actionable across all of our titles.  RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with analysts and live producers to identify strategic business questions, key metrics, and actionable insights. Provide consumer-ready recommendations, insights and reporting to Analytics team leadership, live producers, product managers and partner groups. Effectively translate statistical findings into actionable recommendations for senior leaders on game and business teams. Research and develop state-of-the-art data mining and statistical modeling solutions to understand game design, system performance and key business behaviors, such as player engagement. Drive needle moving improvements via hands-on exploration of data, dashboards, statistical analysis and predictive modeling. Combine qualitative and quantitative driven insights with game knowledge to recommend potential avenues to the game and business teams. Drive requirements for data collection and for data modeling with data engineers Work within a team of data analysts and engineers. QUALIFICATIONS 5+ years in a similar position or an analytics role in the marketing, finance, forensics, or technology fields. Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operational Research, Business Intelligence or any other relevant field). Graduate degree (MBA, MSc or masters, PHD), an asset. Extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques, languages, software and systems (SAS, R, Matlab, Python, SPSS, Tableau) required. Extensive knowledge in SQL (or a SQL-like language) required. Experience with Vertica and Hadoop, an asset. Game industry experience strongly desired. SKILLS Story telling. Ability to develop and maintain good relations and communicate with people at all hierarchical levels. Strong problem-solving skills. Ability to reconcile technical and business perspectives. Autonomy and entrepreneurship. Strong team spirit. Passion for Rockstar Games and our titles.

About Citi  Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.  The ICG Client Analytics Group was created to establish consistent client metrics, segmentation and insights across ICG businesses and regions in order to better identify potential opportunities. It is responsible for the implementation of cross-divisional client metrics including revenue, profitability and market share, as well as client segmentation based on opportunity, client feedback and client content based on event probabilities.  The Market & Competitor Analytics team within ICG Client Analytics provides analytical and reporting services focused on Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory (BCMA) and communicates insights to the business and senior management that help drive strategic decision making. Responsibilities include reporting and analysis on corporate and investment banking wallet and share, market volumes, competitive metrics, deal wins/losses tracking, client targeting and in-depth client entity concordance and management. The team has a small global staff based in NY and Mumbai and works with BCMA staff globally across all geographies and industry sectors as well numerous functional areas: Finance, Public Affairs, HR and Technology.  Responsibilities: Validate and ensure data integrity, accuracy and consistency across a broad spectrum of client entity structures and reportsDaily, weekly, monthly and quarterly wallet and market share reporting and analysis, by product, sector, geography and client segments sourced from Dealogic and internal Citi systemsAnalyze Citi’s competitive share position, strength and weakness by product, sector and geographyProvide ad hoc and bespoke data, presentations and independent analysis for internal clients and business reviews Bachelor’s degree;1 years of experience as an Analyst;Financial Industry experience preferredCuriosity in the Corporate and Investment Banking competitive landscapeExceptional communication skills and ability to collaborate with internal partners and interact with senior stakeholdersAttention to detail, strong technical, analytical, data driven skillsProficiency in Excel (pivot tables, nested formulas, vlookup, charting) and PowerPoint; Excel skills to be evaluatedExperience with Dealogic or Thomson Reuters Deal Intelligence/SDC Platinum is preferredKnowledge of or interest in learning SQL

*Description** The US Data Management Analyst is based within the US CDO team established in 2016, as part of an HSBC wide program who will assist to manage the execution of Data Quality Improvement Programs, including developing deliverables, updating project plans and status reports, and communicating with stakeholders to manage to results *Principal Accountabilities: Key activities and decision making areas** + Provide support to complete specific project deliverables and activities, such as documentation of requirements and data remediation strategies across the Data Governance, Data Usage and Flow, Data Quality Measurement, and Data Quality Issue Management work streams  + Create and maintain project plans and status reports, tracking progress within and across work streams, to confirm that appropriate progress is being made in relation to milestones and deadlines  + Identify and monitor risks and issues, and support mitigation and resolution efforts, such as escalating to the appropriate contacts  + Serve as the liaison between the Data Governance, Data Usage and Flow, Data Quality Measurement, and Data Quality Issue Management work streams, and facilitate appropriate stakeholder involvement  + Coordinate meetings and document meeting minutes to ensure decisions and knowledge obtained via critical working groups, steering committees, and administrative meetings are shared with relevant stakeholders  + Perform ad hoc analyses for the Data Quality Improvement Programs Leads as needed *Major Challenges** + Data management is an evolving concept for HSBC and integration of new activities into the existing SDLC/ Program Management lifecycle will be a learning experience. Some employees will be open to it and others might be threatened by it. The challenge will be to influence colleagues at all levels of seniority to embrace the practicalities of a data quality culture.  + Logistical and technical challenges of implementing data analytics capabilities  + Managing expectations of multiple stakeholders and resolving conflicts.  + Complex system landscape and (initially ?client?) data processes.  + Country specific restrictions (e.g. data sharing) which must be considered in every project/initiative.  + The role continually requires a responsive approach to both regulatory and legal initiatives outside the jobholder?s control and an awareness of the business environments supported.  + Data quality is a wide scale problem across HSBC, clear identification and prioritization will be needed to ensure time and resources are spent in the right areas. *Role Context** + The role requires a strong core contributor who can work under minimal supervision and has attention to detail  + The individual will be pro-active, independent, able to work with all levels of management to propose solutions and then influence change *Management of Risk** + Maintain awareness of operational risk and minimize the likelihood of it occurring including its identification, assessment, mitigation and control, loss identification and reporting in accordance with section B.1.2 of the Group Operations FIM. *Observation of Internal Controls** + Maintain and observe HSBC internal control standards, implement and observe Group Compliance Policy, including the timely implementation of recommendations made by internal/external auditors and external regulators. Foster a compliance culture and implement Group Compliance Policy by managing compliance risk in liaison with the Head of Group Compliance, Regional Compliance Officer, Area Compliance Officer or Local Compliance Officer, ensuring adequate compliance resources are in place and training is provided, and optimizing relations with regulators. *Qualifications** + Banking experience with good knowledge of investment banking and/or global markets  + Possesses very strong management, analytical and interpersonal skills.  + Proven ability to prioritize competing demands  + Excellent organizational, planning and management skills  + Ability to build relationships by communicating, influencing and negotiating effectively with business heads, senior managers, consultants, technical experts across the whole department and business users  + Be delivery focused with ability to pay attention to detail and ensure tasks are completed on time and to the required levels of quality.  + Proven experience in identifying and managing the risks, issues and dependencies related to complex data projects  + Experience in the Finance and Banking industry environment (e.g., fund administrator, brokerage house, custodian, investment bank etc.) together with business project management experience  + Structured approach to programme and project manager including promoting and ensuring adherence to the project management framework defined by the HSBC  + Good knowledge of regulatory trends and developments (with particular data focus)  + Strong interpersonal skills and able to build and maintain global relationships  + Outstanding written / verbal communication and presentation skills  + Planning, time management and resource management skills  + Previous experience in delivery of projects.
